hints_html:
Note that 7 days from now, we are at the same day we were at today. So it suffices to compute this number modulo 7 then count that many days from today (Monday).

Euler’s Formula will help a lot.

sols_html:
The answer is d = Wednesday

Proceeding as in the hints, we need to compute

\(\displaystyle 10^{200000000000} \equiv 3^{200000000000} \mod{7}\)

We use Euler’s formula which states that

\(3^{\phi(7)} = 3^{6} \equiv 1 \mod{7}\)

Next, notice that \(\displaystyle 200000000000\) is not divisible by 6 (the sum of the digits is not divisible by 3 so the number is not divisible by 3). However \(\displaystyle 200000000004\) is divisible by 6 and thus, \(\displaystyle 200000000004-6 = 199999999998 = 6s\) is divisible by 6 (here we let s be an integer). Hence

\[\begin{aligned} 10^{200000000000} &\equiv 3^{200000000000} \mod{7}\\ &\equiv 3^{2}\cdot 3^{199999999998} \mod{7}\\ &\equiv 2\cdot (3^{6})^{s} \mod{7}\\ &\equiv 2 \mod{7}\end{aligned}\]

and thus, two days from Monday is a Wednesday.
